name: Universal tutorial
courseInfo: In this section, the Angular CLI compiles and bundles the Universal version of the application with the Ahead-of-Time (AOT) compiler.

name: Why use server-side rendering?
courseInfo: There are three main reasons to create a Universal version of your application.

name: Universal web servers
courseInfo: A Universal web server responds to application page requests with static HTML rendered by the Universal template engine. The server receives and responds to HTTP requests from clients (usually browsers), and serves static assets such as scripts, CSS, and images. It might respond to data requests, either directly or as a proxy to a separate data server.
